author: Anmol Sharma
content: World number one chess player Magnus Carlsen, who's the defending world chess champion, said that he'll not defend his world championship title in 2023. "I am not motivated to play another match. I simply feel that I don't have a lot to gain," he said. "It didn't mean anything to me," he added, talking about defending the title in 2021.
title: World chess champion Magnus Carlsen to give up his title

author: Anmol Sharma
content: Talking about all-rounder Hardik Pandya, former Team India strength and conditioning coach Shanker Basu said that he was sore during the 2019 World Cup after having played IPL ahead of the ICC tournament. "He said to me 'Sir, please get me through this World Cup. I need to be fit'. And I got him through," Basu stated.
title: Hardik Pandya said 'Sir, please get me through 2019 World Cup': Ex-India trainer

author: Anmol Sharma
content: England's 23-year-old debutant Matthew Potts left the field after bowling just four overs in the first ODI against South Africa at the Riverside Ground in Chester-le-Street due to record-breaking heat. Potts was seen sitting in the changing room and rehydrated with a fan on his face. Temperatures at Chester-le-Street hit a record 39°C on Tuesday.
title: England debutant Potts leaves field after bowling just 4 overs over record-breaking heat

author: Ankush Verma
content: An old picture showing 8-year-old Naomi Osaka watching Rafael Nadal play at the US Open has gone viral on social media. Osaka, now 24, won the US Open in 2018 and 2020. Reacting to the picture that was shared by a user on Twitter, users wrote, "What a moment in time captured," and "Omggggggg this picture is iconic."
title: Old pic showing 8-yr-old Naomi Osaka watching Nadal play at US Open goes viral

author: Anmol Sharma
content: During the T20 World Cup 2022 Trophy Tour, Australia leg-spinner Adam Zampa took the trophy underwater at the Great Barrier Reef. "It’s a privilege to be able to bring the World Cup trophy to this precious place and encourage fans around the world to get to Australia later this year," Zampa said. The tournament will commence in Australia in October.
title: Australia cricketer Adam Zampa takes T20 World Cup 2022 trophy underwater, pics surface

author: Anmol Sharma
content: While interacting with athletes who will represent India at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022, PM Narendra Modi said, "Play with 'Kohi nahi hai takkar mai, kahan pade ho chakkar mai' mantra." "Play well with all your strengths, without stress," PM Modi added. CWG 2022 will take place in Birmingham and will begin on July 28.
title: Play with 'Koi nahi hai takkar mai, kahan pade ho chakkar mai' mantra: PM to CWG athletes

author: Anmol Sharma
content: England all-rounder Ben Stokes gifted his last-ever ODI cap to a young fan, with pictures of the fan wearing the signed cap going viral. "What a souvenir! Wow," a fan commented on the picture. "Lucky kid," wrote another. Stokes registered bowling figures of 5-0-44-0 and scored 5(11) in his last ODI against South Africa on Tuesday.
title: Ben Stokes gifts his last-ever ODI cap to a young fan, pics go viral

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: Team India arrived in Trinidad on Wednesday ahead of their white-ball series, which is scheduled to begin on Friday. India will play a three-match ODI series between July 22 to July 27 and five-match T20I series beginning on July 29. Senior players including Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah have been rested, with Shikhar Dhawan captaining in ODIs.
title: Team India arrive in Trinidad for white-ball series vs WI

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: Ex-Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Kamran Akmal has criticised those questioning Virat Kohli's current form, stating that every cricketer "goes through these phases". "Some players endure it for a brief period, some...for long...[but] people who've played one-two matches are giving opinions on him. I can only laugh," added Akmal. Kohli last scored a century in international cricket in November 2019.
title: Those who've played 1-2 matches are giving opinions on Kohli: Kamran Akmal

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said all-rounder Hardik Pandya can make it to any team in Test matches purely as a batter. Virat Kohli had earlier said that Hardik will need to bowl in Tests. "[I don't see] Hardik bowling 15 to 18 overs a day...He's far away from getting into the red-ball circuit," ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer had stated.
title: Hardik can make it to any team for Tests purely as a batter: Nehra

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar has said Jasprit Bumrah's execution was absolutely spot on during the ODIs against England. "Yes, there was help in the pitch, the conditions were suitable for fast bowling but the execution of his skills was absolutely spot on...We saw everything that a fast bowler should have," stated Agarkar. Bumrah picked eight wickets in two England ODIs.
title: Bumrah's execution was absolutely spot on against England: Agarkar

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Ex-Indian cricketers Yuvraj Singh, Harbhajan Singh and Suresh Raina have been reportedly approached to participate in the tenth season of the reality dance show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa'. Ex-Sri Lankan player Lasith Malinga has also been approached, the reports added. A source informed ETimes TV that there are high chances of Yuvraj doing the show and will soon sign the deal.
title: Yuvraj Singh, Harbhajan approached for 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10': Reports

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Following Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski's transfer to Barcelona, Bayern Munich manager Julian Nagelsmann said, "Barcelona [are] the only club that [have] no money but then...[buy] every player they want." "I do not know how [they do it]. It is kind of weird...crazy," added Nagelsmann. Barcelona President Joan Laporta Estruch had recently said the club is in the "ICU" financially.
title: Barca only club to have no money but buy every player: Bayern's Nagelsmann

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler has said Ben Stokes' ODI retirement should be a "wake-up call" in terms of managing the workload of players. "There's a bit of sadness...But our loss in ODI cricket is certainly going to be England's gain in Test cricket," added Buttler. Stokes announced ODI retirement stating that playing all three formats is "unsustainable" for him.
title: It should definitely be a wake-up call: Buttler on Stokes' ODI retirement

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Discussing Virat Kohli's run drought, former India wicketkeeper Syed Kirmani said, "Had it been someone else in place of Virat, he would've been dropped...by now." Kapil Dev earlier suggested that Kohli should be dropped from India's T20I side considering his performances with the bat. "If he isn't performing...you can't keep the performing youngsters out of the team," he had stated.
title: Someone else in place of Kohli would've been dropped by now: Kirmani

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: England pacer Mark Wood, who has been out of the England squad since suffering an elbow injury against West Indies in March, has revealed that he needs another operation on his elbow. "I'm struggling to be honest...I'm struggling to fully straighten it," stated Wood. "I've got to get it sorted...if I want to be fit for T20 WC," he added.
title: I'm struggling, need another operation: Wood on injury he suffered in March

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: West Indies white-ball captain Nicholas Pooran has said he wants to send a message to the cricketing world by challenging India's match-winners in their upcoming series. On his side's current form in ODI cricket, Pooran said, "We're trying to find out the right mindset for ODI cricket." West Indies recently lost three-match ODI series at home against Bangladesh.
title: If we challenge India's match-winners, it'll be a message to the world: Pooran

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Shoaib Akhtar said Hardik Pandya got a "good shock" when he was out of the team for one-two years as he was unfit and casual. "He's become serious about his fitness," added Akhtar. Talking about Rishabh Pant, Akhtar stated, "My advice...would be to improve his physique...He is a little overweight." "He's good-looking...[and] can emerge as a model, earn in crores."
title: Hardik got a good shock when he was out of team for 1-2 yrs: Akhtar

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: Pakistan recorded the highest successful run chase in Test cricket at the Galle International Stadium as they defeated Sri Lanka by four wickets. Pakistan chased down a target of 342 runs to win the match and take a 1-0 lead in the two-Test series. The previous highest successful fourth-innings chase was 268 by Sri Lanka versus New Zealand in 2019.
title: Pak record highest successful run chase at Galle Stadium in Test win vs SL

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: Pakistan captain Babar Azam completed 3,000 runs in Test cricket in the first Test against Sri Lanka at Galle. In his 73 innings, Babar has now scored 3,025 runs, including seven centuries and 22 half-centuries, at an average of 47.26. In the match against Sri Lanka, Babar scored 119 runs in the first innings and 55 in the second.
title: Babar Azam completes 3,000 runs in Test cricket

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris has said Ben Stokes' ODI retirement might be beneficial for the IPL as the England all-rounder might play in the tournament. Stokes had pulled out of IPL 2022 to focus on Test cricket. Styris further said the ODI format is "not in trouble" given "how big" the ODI World Cup was in 2019.
title: It might well be that IPL is a beneficiary: Scott Styris on Stokes' ODI retirement

author: Arnab Mukherji
content: Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal said he "doesn't know" where Pakistan cricket is going, considering entry to high-performance training camps being denied to players, who have represented the nation in 100-150 matches. "Can they stop Wasim Akram, Shoaib Akhtar...?...[PCB Chairman] Ramiz Raja used to come...years after retiring from the game. Can [they]...dare to stop him now?" added Kamran.
title: I don't know where we are going: Kamran Akmal on Pakistan cricket

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: Cricketer-turned-commentator Rohan Gavaskar has said it's "unfair" to say that the upcoming three-match ODI series against West Indies is "make or break" for Shikhar Dhawan. "Dhawan is an exceptional performer in international cricket and he has been so for a while...Even if he stops playing tomorrow, he will look back at his career with a lot of pride," stated Rohan.
title: It's unfair to say ODI series vs WI is make or break for Dhawan: Rohan Gavaskar

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: England captain Jos Buttler said they couldn't find the spark with the ball in their defeat against South Africa on Tuesday. "It was a fantastic partnership between Rassie van der Dussen and Aiden Markram and we were not able to break that," he stated. South Africa posted 333/5 and then bundled out England for 271 to win the first ODI.
title: Could not find spark with the ball: Buttler on defeat against SA

author: Ankur Taliyan
content: While interacting with athletes who will represent India at the CWG 2022, PM Narendra Modi gave a message to those athletes who'll represent India at the international level for the first time. "I'd say the ground has changed, not your mood, not your stubbornness. The goal is to see the tricolour fluttering...make an impact with...strong game," said PM Modi.
title: Ground will change but not your stubbornness: PM Modi to CWG athletes
